Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Membro dell'editoral board di Rivista di estetica
Assistant editor di Brill Research Perspectives in Art and Law

Autore della voce “On Time in Cinema” nel "The Routledge Handbook of the Philosophy of Temporal Experience", edito da Ian Phillips per Routledge, New York (data di accettazione del mio testo: 30.06.2016; data di pubblicazione del volume: 2017).

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Talk: “Medium is the Archive”, XVIII International Film Studies Conference, “The Archive. Memory, Cinema, Video and the Image of the Present”, University of Udine

Member of the organizing committee of the national conference in Torino: “Estetica | Aesthetica | Aisthesis – IX Convegno Nazionale della Società Italiana d’Estetica” (Conference of the Italian Society for Aesthetics) Organized by: Università di Torino
Talk: “Making the Social World without Words”, International Conference, “Making the Social World”, San Raffaele University, Milan
Talk: “Art Acts”, ECAP (European Conference of Analytic Philosophy) 7, San Raffaele University, Milan
Talk: “How to do Worlds with Words”, XIX International Film Studies Conference, “Can We Learn Cinema?”, University of Udine
Talk: “The Fictional World Viewed”, SoPhA 2012 (Triennial Congress of the Francophone Society for Analytic Philosophy), ENS, Paris
Talk: “The Digital Secret of the Moving Image”, ESA Conference 2012, Universidade do Minho, Guimaraes & Braga
Talk: “Do we really see-in movies?”, SIFA (Italian Society for Analytic Philosophy) Twentieth Anniversary Conference, University of Sassari, Alghero
Talk: “How to Do Things with Uses. Social Reality and the Skeptical Paradox”, ENPOSS (European Network for the Philosophy of the Social Sciences), University of Copenhagen
Talk: “Originally Nested. Twofoldness and Twotierness in the Experience of Pictures”, ESA (European Society for Aesthetics) Conference 2013, Charles University, Prague
Talk: “What Shows Itself. On a Distinctively Cinematic Achievement”, Dubrovnik Conference on the Philosophy of Art, Inter-University Centre in Dubrovnik

Talk: “Types and Sensibilia. Being Realist towards Films”, Consequences of Realism, International Conference, Rome, MAXXI Museo nazionale delle arti del XXI secolo, Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche (CNR), Università Roma Tre
Talk: “The Eternal Present of Cinema”, Philosophy and Film International Conference: Lisbon 2014, Thinking reality and time through film, Centro de Filosofia da Universidade de Lisboa
Talk: “Definition of art, ontology, and aesthetic appraisal: a neo-Strawsonian approach”, International Conference: ‘I know What Art Is When I See It’ Reasons (Not) to Define Art, University of Ghent
Talk: “What Shows Itself. On a Distinctively Cinematic Achievement”, VIth Mediterranean Congress of Aesthetics, University Paris 1, Panthéon-Sorbonne & CNRS, Villa Finaly, Florence
Response to Gianfranco Mormino’s talk “Imagination and Memory in a Deterministic Perspective: the Spinozan Approach”, Nonperceptual Sensuous States Workshop, University of York
Member of the organizing committee of: “International Chair of Philosophy: Jacques Derrida – Law And Culture”, in Torino. Organized by: LabOnt (Università di Torino).
Talk: “What Shows Itself. On a Distinctively Cinematic Achievement”, The American Society for Aesthetics 72nd Annual Meeting, San Antonio, Texas
Talk: “Neither Here or There, but Now: Perception of Films and the Aesthetic Illusion”, The X. Prague Interpretation Colloquium: The Aesthetic Illusion in Literature and the Arts, Prague

Talk: “World Wide What? The Ontological Singularity of the Web”, “Total Mobilization: Web and Social Reality” International Conference, Iri – Centre Pompidou et Collège d'études mondiales – FMSH, Paris

Member of the organizing committee of the international conference in Paris: “Total Mobilization: Web and Social Reality” Organized by: Collège d’études mondiales – FMSH, in collaboration with: Iri (Centre Pompidou) and LabOnt (Università di Torino). Website: http://www.fmsh.fr/fr/c/7775

Talk: “Like Giants Immersed in Time. Four Dimensionalism, Perceptual Experience, and Marcel Proust”; Metaphysical Questions: An International Conference, Università degli Studi di Milano, Palazzo Feltrinelli, Gargnano sul Garda, Brescia
Talk: “Imagination, Film Experience, and Three Meanings of 'Seeing'”, The Roots of Fiction: Possibilities and Imagination, Workshop at the University of Macau
Talk: “Twofileness: Fictional Characters as Generators of Mental Files”, BSA Conference on Fictional Characters, University of Southampton

Talk: “Like Giants Immersed in Time: Four-Dimensional Wholes and The Temporal Experience”, Philosophical Symposium: Composition as Diversity - Experiencing Ontological Wholes, Scuola di Dottorato in Scienze Umanistiche e della Società, Università degli Studi di Ferrara
Talk: “To Be Assessed. Peter Strawson on the Definition of Art”, ESA (European Society for Aesthetics) Conference 2016, University of Barcelona, Barcelona
Talk: “The Band of Theseus. Social Ontology and Mental Files”, European Network for the Philosophy of the Social Sciences (ENPOSS), University of Helsinki, Finland
Talk: “Are You Imagining Me? Four Theses on Imagination and the Film Experience”, White Rose Aesthetics Forum, University of Sheffield
Member of the organizing committee of the workshop in Paris: “Dans la toile du Web” Organized by: Collège d’études mondiales – FMSH. Website: http://www.fmsh.fr/fr/c/9105

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Dottorato in filosofia presso Università di Torino Tesi: “Instances of Cinema. An Ontological Account of Depiction” Supervisore: Maurizio Ferraris (Università di Torino) Commmissione di valutazione: Simona Chiodo (Politecnico di Milano), Gregory Currie (University of York), Robert Hopkins (New York University).
Visiting doctoral student in Philosophy at McGill University, Montréal (under the supervision of Professor David Davies)
Visiting doctoral student in Philosophy at the University of Sheffield (under the supervision of Professor Robert Hopkins)

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Organizer (with Filippo Contesi and Nicole Hall) of the seminar: Aesthetics and Cognitive Science (ÆCS) Institut Jean Nicod, CNRS-EHESS-ENS, Paris Website: http://www.institutnicod.org/seminaires-colloques/seminaires/aecs

In this date my paper “Character, Spectator, Film: On Cinema as a Plotinian Hierarchy” has been accepted for publication in Thorsten Botz-Bornstein and Giannis Stamatellos (eds.), Plotinus and the Moving Image: Neoplatonism and Film Theory, “Philosophy of Film” Series, Brill/Rodopi, Leiden (forthcoming in 2017)
In this date my paper “On Fictional Characters as Types” has been accepted for publication in the British Journal of Aesthetics (forthcoming in 2017)

In this date my paper “Blessed Are the Forgetful: Utilitarianism and Remarriage in Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind” has been accepted for publication in the journal Film and Philosophy, vol. 21 (forthcoming in 2017)

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Since 2011 Member of LabOnt – Laboratory for Ontology Dipartimento di filosofia, Università di Torino, Via Sant’Ottavio, 20 – Torino http://labont.it/people/enrico-terrone
membro del gruppo di ricerca PRIN "Realismo e oggettività"

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Fellow at the Käte Hamburger Kolleg “Recht als Kultur”, Bonn (Germany) http://www.recht-als-kultur.de/en/fellows/former-fellows/terrone/
